intro: Urandra comosa, commonly known as the silky urandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas within forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
